conversation.message: Hello School_A Admissions Committee—I'm Student_A and I’m formally applying because School_A is my first-choice school. I’m especially excited about joining a rigorous academic environment and contributing actively to the school community. If admitted, I would enthusiastically accept and commit to enrolling. Thank you for your consideration.

Although School_A ranks me 3rd (behind Student_B and Student_D), applying now gives me the best chance to secure my first choice before seats are taken. I will express strong fit and commitment to encourage acceptance if they have discretion among applicants.

conversation.message: Dear Student_A, thank you for your application and for naming School_A as your first choice. We are pleased to offer you admission to School_A. We’re excited about the academic and community contributions you described and look forward to having you join us.
conversation.thought: Student_A is 3rd on School_A’s true priority list (behind Student_B and Student_D). However, in this round only Student_A applied to School_A, and Student_A ranks School_A as their first choice, so accepting now secures a solid match and uses our single quota. Waiting risks ending up unmatched if Student_B/Student_D never apply, since they prefer other schools first (Student_B: School_B first; Student_D: School_C first). Given quota=1 and no higher-priority applicants currently in the inbox, accept Student_A.

However, Student_C (my top choice) and Student_B (second) have not applied yet; given the market, Student_C prefers School_D then School_A then School_B then School_C, so they are unlikely to come to me early, but they could if rejected elsewhere. Student_B ranks School_C last, so unlikely. Student_D ranks School_C first and is also highly prioritized by other schools (top at School_B and School_D), so if I reject I may lose them. With quota 1 and no mechanism to hold offers, accepting Student_D now secures a relatively high-ranked match and avoids ending up with a lower-ranked student or unfilled seat.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_E,

Thank you for checking in, and we appreciate your continued interest in School_B.

At this point, we are still keeping our remaining seat available for candidates who are higher on our priority list and may apply in upcoming rounds. Because of that, we’re not in a position to make an offer to you right now.

If your situation changes (for example, if School_B becomes your confirmed top choice and you would be ready to apply immediately again in a later round), you’re welcome to reach out. We’ll continue to review the pool each round as it develops.

Sincerely,
School_B Admissions

Given the objective to match as high as possible on our priority list and that we are not at the final round, the best move is to continue talking and signal that we are still prioritizing higher-ranked candidates, without committing. Use [TALK] since Student_E used [TALK].
